issue.title: Issues found by OSS Fuzz

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Issues found by [oss-fuzz](https://github.com/google/oss-fuzz):

- [x] #1538 :warning: Affects fuzzing
- [x] #1539 :warning: Affects fuzzing
- [x] #1540
- [x] #1541 :warning: Affects fuzzing
- [x] #1542 :warning: Affects fuzzing
- [x] #1543
- [x] #1544
- [x] #1545
- [x] #1546
- [x] #1548 
- [x] #1566

Please let me know, if someone is interested in fixing an issue so can provide further information.

Related: #1502 

/cc @jhy

body:
This one results in: 
```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
	at java.util.Arrays.copyOf(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.ensureCapacityInternal(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(Unknown Source)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.indent(Node.java:639)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Element.outerHtmlTail(Element.java:1506)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Node$OuterHtmlVisitor.tail(Node.java:749)
	at org.jsoup.select.NodeTraversor.traverse(NodeTraversor.java:31)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.outerHtml(Node.java:606)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Element.html(Element.java:1529)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Element.html(Element.java:1520)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Document.outerHtml(Document.java:213)
	at org.jsoup.nodes.Node.toString(Node.java:635)
	at java.lang.String.valueOf(Unknown Source)
	at java.io.PrintStream.println(Unknown Source)
	at JsoupIssue1544.main(JsoupIssue1544.java:15)
```
To reproduce:
```
Jsoup.parse(new String(Files.readAllBytes(Paths.get("1544.txt"))));
```
[1544.txt](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/files/6497442/1544.txt)

Hmm, I can't get this one to repro. The timeout issue is different to the OOM @krystiangorecki reports. For the reported timeout, on my laptop it completes in 15 seconds (vs 60 second timeout). Will take a look to see if we can pull in the processing speed.

I think the issue @krystiangorecki saw was fixed in afd73606a90909444e1c443b555dae7b71e6a5a0 (assuming you're not on HEAD?)

OK, by limiting the queue depth we scan for formatting elements to <= 256, the performance here is significantly improved. From ~ 14 seconds to 355ms on my laptop. More importantly, it's no longer unbounded.
